metadata.title: CVE-2019-11758 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla community member Philipp reported a memory safety bug present inFirefox 68 when 360 Total Security was installed. This bug showed evidenceof memory corruption in the accessibility engine and we presume that withenough effort that it could be exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 69, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR <68.2.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
